p:
The inhibition of the growth of E. coli, K. pneumoniae, S. aureus, P. aeruginosa and E. faecalis was previously reported [
4 ,
7 ,
9 ] along with the efficacy against C. albicans [
9 ,
16 ,
17 ] and S. typhimurium [
4 ,
9 ], respectively. In contrast, some studies report the inefficiency of thyme EO against E. coli [
16 ,
17 ], S. aureus [
16 ] and K. pneumoniae [
16 ].
